comment_data.body:
need to mention lspconfig, I don't think notify() does that automatically?


But given that we are using `vim.uv`, this should probably be an assert()?

```suggestion
    'nvim-lspconfig requires Nvim version %s, but you are running: %s',
```

comment_data.body: I'm confused. What does this have to do with `vim.uv` (other than that the PR for it happened to inspire this one)? I imagine this to be a general-purpose warning that we can continually use whenever we need to bump the minimum version, rather than a one-time thing.

comment_data.body:
since https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/commit/c25b9dd6bddb125b538f3f01cb47b4a6e606f6c5 , there will be an error for any Nvim version that doesn't have vim.uv

allowing execution to continue after this warning means that there will be a error because of the vim.uv reference

comment_data.body: Still not entirely sure if `vim.uv` is relevant, it just happens to be the last thing that broke (but in the future there might be some other function), so don't really see the value in hardcoding it to the existence of `vim.uv`. Let's throw an error instead of warning? I'll update the code and we can take a look.

comment_regular_data.body: I anticipate the most annoying thing about this will be to remember to update this value. Maybe we could add a CI check for it.
Just a heads up, the error message parsing doesn't work in older versions of Neovim. In Neovim <0.10 parsing `vim.version` as a string gives `table: 0x<hex>`

We could backport the new `__tostring()` method into the `lspconfig` utils so that it can be used the same until 0.10 is no longer supported at least

```lua
function version_string()
  local ret = table.concat({ self.major, self.minor, self.patch }, '.')
  if self.prerelease then
    ret = ret .. '-' .. self.prerelease
  end
  if self.build and self.build ~= vim.NIL then
    ret = ret .. '+' .. self.build
  end
  return ret
end
```
Thanks, yeah that would be helpful.
I can open a PR with this in like an hour if no one gets to it by then
Actually, I got a moment so I opened a quick one: https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/pull/3345
